author: BigMack12345
title: Great App!
content:
Snapchat is a great app to connect with your friends and family members, I absolutely adore it. However, there are two things I would like to see change. The first thing is the Bitmojis.  I agree, they are a lot of fun and very entertaining, but, I would like to have the option to change my profile picture to an actual picture of myself instead of the Bitmoji. I know a lot my friends agree with me on this, and this change would not completely get rid of the Bitmojis, rather,  it would allow your audience to have the choice to choose between a gif of themselves for their snapcode, or, their Bitmoji. The other change I would love to see happen is to improve the quality of snapchats being sent. I know whenever I take a picture or video on Snapchat, the quality at first is amazing with impeccable HD and high saturation.  However, after I send the picture or video to either my story or a friend, the clarity of the picture seems to decrease as the picture becomes more blurry. I know these suggestions may seem like a lot to ask, but I know the majority of my friends agree with me when I say it these changes would definitely help your app Snapchat, appeal to a broader audience. I hope you can take these words into consideration and maybe even make a change. Thank you for your time and understanding! 
                                     Sincerely,
                                        A fellow Snapchat user

author: Blair Nieves (blairnieves22)
title: Notifications
content: I never write reviews for anything so hear me out. I was chillin watching tv and my phone started blowing up. I didn't exactly care for a majority of the conversations I was having. I just wanted to  watch tv. Due to me just wanted to watch my television, I wished to myself that I could customize whose notifications could come through. I decided that I was going to look at the notification settings. As I was on my way to the setting in a doubtful manor, and as I predicted I couldn't customize. Then I started thinking, what if I wrote them a review. In the chance that they might read this and maybe do something about it or at least consider it. I'm suggesting adding a customization option in the notification settings. I have 4 idea I have to take into consideration, in my opinion. My first idea was just simply choosing whose notifications could come through in my friend list. Then I thought about the idea that only my Snapchat streaks notifications could come through. I also considered the idea that only my best friends notifications could come through. Lastly I was thinking about the idea that both my best friends and my streaks notifications could come through. I'm not asking for all of these to be added. I'm only asking one of them to be taken into consideration, and possibly something being added. Thank you for your time.

I absolutely do not like at all that all the tools are on the side now. it's much better at top since it looks neater and now just looks cluttered. I think this was a great idea but you should have kept the set up the same and some of the other features the same, like the showcase of seconds when you open a snap. please and thankyou.

author: Skyehighflypie
title: Just a suggestion
content:
I love snapchat, I always have :) but there are a few things that I think would make it even more user friendly. 
I'm a streak addict, so if there was a button that selected all streaks when sending snaps, it would make keeping up with them so much easier. 
I LOVE filters, and I find myself using the same few over and over again. If the filters were in the order of most recently used, it would make selecting them quicker, and more accessible. 
Now, this is an issue I've encountered on my own: My account is public because I have a little bit of a fanbase build up online, so there are a ton of people that I would like to see my story, but I don't necessarily snap them so I don't have them on my friends list. When I have to block certain users (that are on my friends list) from seeing my story, my account becomes private and only those on my friends list can see my story. Then my fans can't see my story. (To get around this I've just blocked users, including my friends, completely) It would be great if I could block people from seeing my story and keep them on my friends list, as well as keep my account public. 
Again, I love snapchat with all my heart! I use it everyday and I couldn't imagine a phone without it. I hope this review is helpful, and hopefully we'll see some of the features I mentioned in the future! :)

author: Love Live-er
title: News is still rubbish, as expected
content: Once again, all basic necessities, taking photos and chats, from the app have been optimized as they should. Well done there Snapchat. However, I once again suggest that the "news" feed in discover to be fixed, or preferably removed or receive an option to tweak and choose the sources, as soon as possible. The "news" sources provided are blatantly one-sided as well as ill-informed on the topics they try to cover. Sources such as MTV, Complex, Buzzfeed for "news" is not news period! No further explanation needed. Those "news outlets" are blatantly promoting vile and just degenerate behaviors and lifestyles, which would be tolerable if this was an adult only app, to all the young users on Snapchat. These displays of hedonism and over-sexualization are unacceptable to be shown to the large young audience that has been drawn to the allure of this simple social media app. The borderline pornographic content of some of "news" should be placed where it belongs, in a porn site, and not a massive, popular and continuously growing media platform that contains people of all ages. That's not even mentioning the vomit inducing content such as "24 things people with big butts can get away with" and "women gone truly wild". I will continue to monitor the apps content for a long time and will continue to voice myself until this is changed appropriately. Once again, fix this.

author: Magnetic Zeroes
title: Can't Login. VERY DISAPPOINTED üò°
content:
I've contacted Snapchat two times about the problems I've been having and I've yet to receive a HUMAN reply. I'm severely disappointed with Snapchat's customer service. Zero stars.
Around July 28ish I began to experience issues with Snapchat, such as some snaps that friends sent not being able to load/not appearing. I'd think that they haven't sent anything at all, but then when I enter the app again, it appears all the sudden. Figuring this was probably just an easy fix, on July 31, I deleted the app, restarted my device, and redownloaded the app. Now, it says "Could Not Connect. Please check your connection and try again" when I try to login. I am still not able to login, even on another device that previously worked. I've tried every trick in the book: redownloading the app, restarting my device, checking my connection, flipping between Wifi and data, and resetting my password. Nothing has worked.
Snapchat has a serious issue, or at least I think it does because I'm almost positive it isn't my phone, and it needs to be fixed ASAP! If anybody is having similar issues, please write a review so Snapchat knows that this is an URGENT PROBLEM. I thought the update would have dealt with this issue but apparently not. I am severely disappointed, and at this moment, even more disappointed with Snapchat's SLOW response to the issues I've presented them.
ZERO stars for customer satisfaction.
ZERO stars for the current version.

author: MEapZ
title: Hey, That‚Äôs Kinda Good
content:
I wish it had more appeal towards alternative consumers. I don‚Äôt essentially care that the color scheme is vivid, and cannot be changed to the user‚Äôs preference. However, it‚Äôs somewhat surprising to see so many filters, and stickers centered around the mainstream culture. 
I honestly don‚Äôt think it‚Äôd kill them (the developers) to take a few minutes listening to (the real) T√òP, or something, and actually understand alternative culture. I‚Äôm not saying completely despise (some) of the filters, but even the ones I generally enjoyed using, (zodiac,) got taken off for another animal-ears filter that‚Äôs probably just a carbon copy of another one that was removed that day. 
In all honesty, I wouldn‚Äôt mind if you just took off the (painfully lazy) spam of face-stretching filters, in exchange for one (larger) filter, where you could manually alter the features to make a custom filter.

On another note, most, if not all of the filters heavily edit the user‚Äôs appearance. There‚Äôs even a filter, (which unfortunately, never goes away) completely centered around the user‚Äôs face shape, completely altering it. Instead, it‚Äôd be somewhat amusing to see what would happen if the user could decide how intense the alterations are.

author: Red Sox are aewsum
title: Not sponsored, honest opinion.
content: this is written from a teenager‚Äôs perspective. snapchat is one of the most enabling apps there is, but it also the most disabling and humbling. the cruelty that is experienced when using this app is unparalleled by anything else in the high school experience. judgmental little pieces of trash can just sit behind their screen and destroy someones day, make fun of people without them knowing, and brag about doing illegal stuff without getting caught. snapchat personifies the problems we have in our world today, especially in the youth category. it enables teenagers to ruin even one of their own classmates lives from miles away. kids my age (highschool) use it to deal drugs without having any repercussions whatsoever. if snapchat revealed any of the photos and texts that they almost certainly have, there would be millions of minor arrests and MIPs. Kids would he jailed for child pornography, it would be a scandal. so of course, this cannot happen. the fact is, kids like to be mean, but most kids are too scared to bully in person. sure, they could do it over text or phone, but snapchat makes it private enough for a bully to tear into someone without feeling even an ounce of remorse. snapchat needs to go.

author: Could you change it?
title: inappropriate
content:
I like snapchat. i get to see what my friends are doing and i can send fun pictures with filters. i can communicate with people who i may not have their number and it is all around useful. however, they recently added their "discover" section and i am not impressed. i ended up deleting the app because nothing in the discover section is appropriate. The articles to read are almost all about sex, or nudity. A recent article they had on their discover section was "How to get Laid for the Holidays." why? i'm pretty sure nobody's reason to download snapchat was to read sex stories and see nude pictures of people. Now kids (11-16 year olds; the general population of people who use snapchat) can come across pornographic pictures and click on them without anybody, like their parents, knowing. why does that seem like a good idea. I hate it and i am a teenager myself. Parents have no idea that their kids are being exposed to these kind of things when they are supposedly just "sending snaps to their friends". 
I tried looking in the settings for somewhere i could opt out the discover, they don't have an option for that and don't even have a option to opt out adult content on it. It's dumb and if adults want to read articles like that there are plenty of other places they can find one other than on the app that was meant for kids to communicate with their  friends. Like i said, I ended up deleting the app because i didn't want to be apart of what snapchat was offering me.

author: Meom8
title: Great App, Just Needs Improvements
content:
Don‚Äôt get me wrong, I love Snapchat. I‚Äôve had it for about two years now and it has been great for me. However there is things that need improvement.

1: Constant Updates
One thing that really annoys me about Snapchat is the constant, unneeded updates that really do nothing to the app but cause glitches. I recommend you slow down a bit and let Snapchat stay a simple app that you can use to send pictures to friends.

2: Discover Page
The discover page is so inappropriate it‚Äôs not even funny. Some of the articles are pretty entertaining but others give a terrible impression to the children that use this app. Most of the people that use Snapchat are 12-16 and the things that are in the discover section are not something that 12-16 years olds should be reading.

3: Slow
Snapchat recently for me had been very slow and laggy. It takes forever for something to send or for the filters to load. Please try  and fix this, I don‚Äôt want to wait 5 minutes for my picture to send.

4: Filters
One of the reasons I downloaded Snapchat was for the filters, but recently the filters have been lacking. Some of them are weird, confusing and just plain stupid. Bring back some of the old filters! Many of my friends agree with me when I say that I want more of the old filters back.

Other than that Snapchat is a great app and I recommend you download it. In the end it‚Äôs a fun way to communicate with friends and family!

author: OhnnyS
title: HATE DISCOVER ARTICLES
content: I've used Snapchat for a long time now it's a very unique way of chatting with friends and especially long distance friends. Cute filters, cute effects, fun bitmojis. My problem with it is that every time I scroll to the right to see my friends stories I get pushed on "news" articles by buzzfeed, cosmopolitan, etc. that are very pointless and unnecessary. If I wanted to read those horrible stories id go to their website. As a young user of Snapchat I would love more than anything to get rid of the sex tips and actually show me something important. I can definitely see why it would be a problem for parents the articles are very explicit for children and usually have a false story of women or people of a different race such as "what women think of sex", "why hispanics hate this thing" and the rest of the majority are stories of the Kardashians....at least give us an option to turn that off it's extremely annoying.

author: Birdenity
title: Some ideas that we ALL want
content: I'm hoping you decide to listen to us (the reviewers) because we have got some ideas that are pretty similar that I've seen. First off please, please, PLEASE. Give us the option to shut off the camera shutter sound. That is usually the only reason my phone is on mute when it shouldn't be its irritating and highly annoying. Next... for our Snapchat lenses you should find more ideas other than animal ears and glasses it's getting old bring back some of the first ones. Lastly give us a category where we put people we are having streaks with so you can have a send all button just for the streaks so we don't have to go through and individually click every streak. I'm sure a forced streak was never the intention rather than one that pops up because real conversations but that's what it's come to so please give us a category and another thing with streaks, we should be able to have streaks with a group chat as long as every person in the chat snaps each day if one person fails to snap the streak is lost. Thank you for your time and the chance to give our feedback I hope it makes a difference:). The app is otherwise wonderful.

author: markiebaby14
title: Snapchat is getting out of hand.
content: Snapchat is now giving out our location to people we are friends with on Snapchat. We have to go to the settings and turn on ghost mode, when it should be already on ghost mode, not off of it. Now people that I really don't know have my location, they could've screenshot it, wrote it down, or whatever. It is irrelevant to even have a map of your Snapchat friends on there. I'm no longer even giving Snapchat permission to have my location while in the privacy of my own home, or anywhere else that is a personal location of mine. In addition, I have lost all trust in Snapchat, we give it permission to have our location, and us snap chat users already trusting that it will be kept safe and private, then to have Snapchat turn around on us and throw out our exact location was not smart, and very unsafe.

author: Shining Emerald
title: Get rid of bitmoji!
content: I use Snapchat often, and have really enjoyed it. When bitmoji was added, I didn't think much of it. I have no reason to ever create a bitmoji other than to be like everyone else, so I just ignored it at first. However, bitmoji seems to be taking over the app. Snapchat just added a new feature where if you post a story, instead of just the names of the people who have viewed your story, you now get their bitmoji as well. This makes it a lot harder to focus on the names of the people, as so many bitmojis are very similar. It was easier to see the names without the bitmojis there, and quite honestly it's just stupid and pointless to put them by the peoples' names. I say get rid of bitmoji in the story "viewed" list, and get it back the way it was before. Quite making everything so complicated.

PLEASE READ AND CONSIDER:
I love this app! But, I wish there was an option where you could stream live on your story like you can on an Instagram story. I mean I like the idea of our story and everything but I think that Snapchat should have an option to stream live from your story and to see other friends stream live on their stories. Also, I think it would be good if Snapchat could notify you whenever a streak with a certain person is almost up I also think the geofilters should be able to flip sideways when you take a landscape photo. Finally I wish there could be an option to record hands free.

author: angelina rinaldi12345678910
title: Overall great app, but....
content:
Ok, so ever since the map came out, my SnapChat has been non-stop glitching out. And it's getting worse as the days go by. I will go into the app and within 5 minutes at most, it will glitch out. Often times I will open all of my stories, then it will glitch out and I will have to reopen all the stories again. Sometimes I will not be able to turn down my brightness, and I have no idea why this could be happening.

Another problem I have been experiencing is I have been logged out multiple time for unknown reasons. I have asked all the people that know my password if they logged in and they all have the same reply, no. It's getting me frustrated. Although this could be an attempt to hack, usually the hacker would change something or do something to mess up thy account, nothing has been changed and messed around with since this has been happening. 

The last problem is that sometimes my streaks disappear for absolute no reason. Even if we have recently sent a snap to each other. Most of the time it comes back later on, but it worries me, even if happens to every high streak. I would love for you to fix these problems, if it's not much to ask. Thank you.

author: LooseHoose
title: New update deleted my Snapcode gif
content:
Hi, this is probably a wicked petty issue I have with the update, but it really irks me:

I deactivated Bitmoji, but it appears to have deleted my Snapcode selfie gif which I've been using since I first downloaded Snapchat, which is a bummer. 

Also some other feedback: I like Bitmoji, but I'm not a huge fan on it appearing everywhere instead of my Snapcode selfie gif. As fun as Bitmoji is and the awesome features it provides, I'd rather have the image I choose represent my Snapchat rather than the Bitmoji's face (As seen on the iOS widget, Quick Chat Search, and now Snapcode, etc). It would be awesome to have a toggle in the Bitmoji menu which allows the display of either Bitmoji or Snapcode selfie on these fronts. After this Snapcode change, I probably won't be activating Bitmoji within Snapchat until something like this is implemented.

Thank you

author: Zarakov
title: P o l i t i c s .
content: Honesty, I love Snapchat. The app is great, it's user-friendly, fun, and it connects people together in ways that most apps do not. There's plenty of content within the app to make it more customized to your person and it allows for a network of people to see what's going on in their friend's lives. But this political stuff has to stop. All I see is "Trump's latest screw up" and "Trump's new agenda" and "Here's what Trump got wrong" from all these left wing news outlets that are basically front-page on Snapchat. Being on a relatively moderate political stance, I don't mind seeing both sides of the argument. But when it comes to Snapchat all I see in the "bad" (if some of it can even be interpreted that way) and nothing "good". I have not see one pro-Trump/Republican/Conservative report on the app yet and it honestly feels like I'm having the left crammed down my throat. Nobody goes to Snapchat for the news, and if you do you REALLY need to broaden your mind to more open ideas because anything that comes out of Snapchat is pretty closed-minded. Get away from the political crap, quit pushing an agenda, and go back to just being a fun, lovable app that doesn't take a political stance.

author: (this is a suggestion)
title: Update idea(s)
content:
‚Ä¢ I think it would be cool if you could have a streak within a group chat. It would be kept if everybody sent something every day. 
‚Ä¢ Snap scores between you and all of your friends. Each person would have their own snap score still, but if you held down on someone's name a number would come up to show how many snaps you have sent just to each other. It could also go up by being in group chats with them, and by viewing each other's stories. 
‚Ä¢ You should be able to see what times people view your story. I know a lot of people who are curious if somebody saw their story immediately or if it was longer. Sometimes people don't check who saw it and by the time they do, so many people have seen it that it's impossible to tell how quickly someone viewed it. 

These are just some ideas I've come up with. I know that they probably won't happen but if someone sees this please take them into consideration! Thank you.

author: Dkkkspappfj
title: Discover articles could use some change
content: This app would be great if there was a way to hide articles on the discovery page. If I hated myself and wanted desperately to waste my time, the discovery page is the place I would go. I get it, people love to stay in the know with all the latest in the Jenners. Great. HOWEVER not everyone wants to be bombarded with articles about celebrities asses or how to have the best oral sex. FURTHER why are the majority of the articles on what women could be doing better? The majority of snapchat users are 18 and under teens. Sending young girls the message that they need to change this or that about their appearance to be liked or that there's this formula to a good relationship is NOT productive. This sends the message that a woman's worth exists only in the way she is viewed by others. To push so many articles like this at an audience of hyper-impressionable girls should be considered a crime! We need to be empowering young women and these messages are the opposite of empowerment. When the discover feature was introduced I remember it helped people to get caught up on current events, there was even a National Geographic section, all of which were much more interesting than the crap that is cluttering snapchat now. Ultimately it would be great if the over sexual content was removed completely however creating a feature which allows users to hide certain kinds of articles would be a step in the right direction.

author: What about Charlie?
title: Didn't like it.
content: First, let me start by saying I am in fact a teenager. And, despite the app's popularity among most teenagers, I really did not enjoy the app for the month and a half that I had it. When you have a Snapchat, people put pressure on you to always read your snaps and respond quickly. If you forget to send them a snap within 24 hours, you are a bad guy, because you "killed the streak." As soon as I get rid of my Snapchat, people became normal around me again. I had less things to worry about, and I feel more relaxed knowing I can live in the moment instead of recording the moment so people can only see it for 24 hours. Basically, I didn't like my experience with Snapchat, and I don't like the obligations that go along with having a Snapchat. I only wish I could free some of my friends from Snapchat too, because it is pitiful seeing people so easily controlled by their phones.

author: SarbearG
title: What could be better about Snapchat
content:
Snapchat my favorite form of communication.

Suggestions?

- Live streaming 
- Do Not Disturb mode
- Being able to send photos from places other than your camera role. Such as being able to pick a picture from a specific album in your photos.
- A "What I'm listening to" filter that can show the music that we're listening to.
- Checking in. This is kind of like the geofilters, but instead of only having it in certain places, you can check into wherever you are.
- GIF stickers
- Being able to zoom in on a picture when drawing on it. This will be great for any snapchat artist. 
- Also different brushes such as calligraphy, highlighter, pencil, pen, etc.

These are just some of the things that I have noticed, that would make my snapchat experience better. I'll come up with more later. Keep up the great work snapchat!

author: KingSheepMC
title: Issues Resolution
content:
Having issues on Snapchat? Here's how to fix them...

1) if Snapchat keeps crashing, uninstall apps and cache, NOT Snapchat.
2) if Sarahah is #1 in the App Store, don't buy it and make it rank down.
3) if you add friends and still says add friend, their account is permanently banned.
4) if your quick add is not updating, new snappers come in your quick add ONCE every 48 hours.
5) if you see a mutual best friends emoji, that cannot be fixed unless you removed that friend and then it will update.
6) if you change your birthdate to younger than 13 years old, boom, your account is instantly banned, but do not create a new one (in the policy).
7) if you add a new friend and does not respond to add you back, wait a bit or friend then again.
8) if you have a third party application, UNINSTALL IT.

author: tootsie-'17

author: Abstergail1344
title: Fix this please!!!
content: So I have been using snapchat for over 4 years now and this just recently started happening after I updated the app. Whenever I am using the filter (you know like the puppy dog one) my phone shuts down completely and says I need to plug my phone in. author: A long-lived user FB
title: Deleted my Snapchat Forever
content:
I've decided that Snapchat isn't future proof, and the software has only entered a downhill roll. Used to be fast and easy to use Fun Messaging App. Now it just tries to do what all the other apps already do... like Overload you with pointless Ads, Messaging Features, Avatars, Battery-killing updates, and the worst looking UI I've seen on any app to date. You'd think they would catch on to all the nasty reviews this past year, but noooo... 

Conclusion is, Snapchat is the same as texting (Or even Facebook Messenger), except only it's a lot slower, requires wifi, you don't know who's looking your messages, and it's just annoying as **** because you feel obligated to look at everyone's stories, as in all of them.

Snapchat is a waste of time. I'm quitting after three years of useage. Instagram will always be my go to.

author: OfficialFatPanda
title: Overall good app.
content:
At first my opinion was a bit close minded and shallow, for example...
"Not a fan of some of the favoritism when it comes to sports. Your target audience is growing smaller. Not everyone watches NFL."

Then I realized that Snapchat has to make its income somehow. We wouldn't want to remake the downfall of Vine.
So overall, I do appreciate that you guys want to keep us entertained and that you don't want to make the media too desperate for clicks, but I still think you're overdoing it by a bit. For example, the "Featured" section or the "Our Stories" section. They still take up a small portion of my stories section and I still periodically have to manually hide them every time I open Snapchat. I guess I'll just learn to live with it for now though. Also, the updates haven't been the most stable, yet, better features are added frequently.

[ I'm incredibly sorry if any of this doesn't make sense, it is currently 1 in the morning. I'll revisit this when I get reminded of an update.]

content: Snapchat is my most used app & I love every part of it except when I'm reading an article/watching a story from the Discover page. author: Tinderplaya
title: The "Snap" part is fine, the rest is trash
content: Yes, the news is one-sided. That's not that big of a deal, as a large majority of news outlets even outside of Snapchat are left-leaning. That doesn't really bother me. What bothers me are the obscene, vile, and crude stories that show up and supposedly pass as "news". I don't have kids of my own yet, but I have younger siblings, and it sickens me to think that they see stories talking about which celebrity has been photographed topless, or who's got a boob job, or 10 things that drive women crazy in bed. Just now I popped open the app and saw "What % sexpert are you?" and "9 people share their weirdest hookup stories." It's revolting that this kind of deplorable garbage is being broadcast to an audience that Snapchat knows is largely very young. I understand that they have to make their money somehow, but this is classless and disgusting. Add some sort of guidelines or filter to control what is being shown. Or AT LEAST a way for parents to control what kind of stories show up. Step up, Snapchat, this is sad.

author: Vasterkoy
title: Chats counting towards streaks!
content:
Snapchat is a great app and way to communicate with friends, but I do have one suggestion. Since everyone puts a huge emphasis on streaks now, I really think that chats should count towards your streak and not just picture messages. I prefer to use chats most of the time because you can type way more and there is no time limit to reading the message but sometimes I forget to send a picture message to keep the streak. I don't see why chats shouldn't count towards your streak, you're still talking to that person! 

Another thing, it would be great if you could fix the bug where sometimes Snapchat opens your snaps for you if you've waited awhile to answer and then you don't get to see them. Other than those two things I mentioned, it's a great app! Thank you for listening, I hope you consider my suggestions :)

author: Naomi11_17
title: Amazing! But...
content: This app was the best app I ever got on my phone (iPod)... but I soon had to delete it. I was having quite a few arguments with friends, and I had a big one. author: Benjaminwilliamm
title: NO MORE PORN
content: When Snapchat first came out, it was such a blast to send funny pictures to friends and laugh about them later. Then the filters came out and made it so much better. However, the discovery portion of Snapchat has gotten out of hand. I understand in order to make more money, advertising needs to happen but that doesn't mean I want to see what is happening with the Kardashians or what the best sex moves are. This is ridiculous. If people want to see this, have them choose to see this. The only option for those of us that don't want to fall into the hyper-sexualized world we live in, is to delete the app. I have deleted it and have had it deleted for months. The pictures and articles found on the discovery page are pornographic in word and image. There are so many children and young people with moldeable minds that are being taught that sending nudes, promiscuity and being more "sexy" in bed is the only way to have a healthy sexual relationship. This is not how the rising generation should be receiving their sex education. Snapchat has turned from a fun innocent social app to a money hungry conglomerate that is normalizing the objectification of humans. I will download and give a better review again when the discovery section is optional. This one small detail really tanks this potentially great app.

author: Delete all pictures of Ron
title: Snapmap ethics?
content:
I'm not one to be worried about surveillance and what not and I don't have a problem with Facebook logging my data and selling my info and what not like I tend to not be worried about any ill effects of any of that stuff but with snapmap this is kinda the first time I'm having to wonder..

Is this like, ok? This doesn't feel ok. It's supper vague about what exactly is available to who and I appreciate ghost mode but I'm not even confident I'm 100 protected with that either. But yeah otherwise the app is fine, maybe a little unintuitive to new users even back when I joined and maybe there are a few to many things going on feature wise now but I mean once you get the hang of it yeah this is a great app and it's the main way I talk to people.
So mostly great.

author: A fed-up Millenial
title: Dangerous App
content: This app puts sexually explicit content in the hands of all of its users, the majority of whom are adolescents under the age of 18. Their discover section, which cannot be disabled or blocked, shows daily content of almost completely nude women whom they praise for their provocative poses and scantily clad photo shoots as well as X-rated articles like "The truth about oral sex". Any impressionable young girl can see these photos and start to believe that showing off their bodies will bring them fame and attention. It goes against all the progress that has been made to stop the objectification of women's bodies; not to mention putting pornographic content in the hands of young boys whose parents may be unaware of the dangers hidden in plain sight on this app. If you are a parent I strongly urge you to ask your children to delete this app. To the snapchat creators: stop putting adult content on an app that you know all too well has a majority user-base of adolescents. Is it really worth corrupting the minds of millions of kids so your CEOs can rack up a few more millions of dollars?

author: Helloy'allpeoplewhoarerrading
title: I am dissatisfied
content: Please note I attempted to send a review to the creators of SnapChat several months ago. It seems they did not take my opinion into consideration whatsoever as nothing has changed. Clearly, after reading a few other reviews I am not the only one who feels this way so I'll say it again. Why? Why is this would-be brilliant and unique form of social media and communication becoming nothing more than a sell-out for biased and unreliable "news" feeds? The majority of the "news" that appears is completely biased and very much leans to the left. If there is to be a news feed on a social media site, let it be, at the very least moderate. I am fed up with the ridiculous levels of unwanted "news" and "stories." They are not needed. Please find an alternative to them, or as I said I would several months again, I will delete my account and encourage others to do the same. Please, SnapChat developers! Take away the biased and unwanted "news" stations on what was once a nice, fun way of communication that was (quite wonderfully) devoid of political scandals that ought not to be propagated online. Thank you for your consideration, and please heed this this time, I beg of you. I do not wish to remove my account, but I shall if this issue is not addressed.

author: Rachiecupcakie
title: I second the concerns
content: I second the concerns and complaints about the explicit content on Snapchat. The magazine content (which users have no control over) that is displayed right under friends' snapchat stories are often explicit without so much as opening the article. They feature barely-covered women and an overwhelming number of sexual images. And that's only the small pictures of the articles...the articles themselves are far too frequently informational articles about sex. If this were an app that only adults used, I would be less concerned. But my little sister and her middle-school friends often use Snapchat as their primary method of communication. It troubles me that they may stumble upon these kinds of images and articles when just scrolling through their friends' stories. I don't want my sister to see a naked Kylie Jenner and learn about sex positions at her age--honestly, it's exploitation. Snapchat, the idea behind this app is wonderful! But you need to know your audience. Know who you're feeding and what you're feeding them. Does Snapchat really need this trashy magazine content? I certainly do not believe so. That's not what people want when they download Snapchat; there are other apps for that. Please, please censor what your viewers are being exposed to! If nothing else, allow users to choose what content appears under their friends' stories. Something needs to change here.

author: AbbyGalee
title: Listen up Snapchat.
content: I used Snapchat for a couple of years, and I always really enjoyed it. I think Snapchat was a wonderful idea! However, recently the Discover Stories have gone from bad to worse. I never looked at the Discover stories, as they had their own page, separate from the Stories page where you view your friends' snap stories. It was great when you didn't have to see the Discover stories if you didn't want to. However, there is no longer a separate page for the Discover stories, and they are displayed in all of their glory right next to your friends' snap stories. This *really* bothers me, particularly because they are quite frequently (actually on a daily basis) vulgar & filled with sexual content. I don't want to see that on the stories page, and judging from many other reviews I read, a lot of Snapchat users don't want to either. I always loved Snapchat before, but I actually deleted the app because of this reason a couple of months ago. I see that many other people feel the same way, and I think Snapchat should listen to this criticism, and not force-feed the disgusting Discover stories to their users. If this is ever changed, I will happily re-install the app. But until then, I'm enjoying my life Snapchat-free. :)

author: ÊÖ∑ÂèØÂÖ∞
title: Used to be great! But...
content:
I used to love this app. That's why it gets 2 stars instead of one. But, it's gotten increasingly worse and worse. 

-I really like having the number of seconds in the top right corner of a snap I watch. It still exists for snaps I receive, but not on stories. Please bring that back. 
-Make all of the lenses work with 2 faces. Why can I use some with my friends and not others? 
-I've recently been having issues with my snapchat camera focusing when my other camera apps focus fine. 
-My time, altitude, and temperature filters have disappeared with the last update. I also don't seem to have filters that my friends have, even if they live in my area. 
-The video chatting feature does not work. 
-I want to see when a person is TYPING. It would be cool to have the little bubble, the one that shows when someone has the chat open, change color when the person is typing. 
-Night Mode should always be an option, like turning the flash on/off. Also, it should work on the selfie camera, not just the back camera.
-I would like an option in settings that allows me to turn off notifications for when someone is typing.

Please take my suggestions and I'll rate the app higher!

author: acornhan
title: Auto Scroll and Tapping Names
content: I was completely fine with the auto scroll occuring when I received a snap but auto scrolling when I deliver one is honestly the most annoying thing ever because when it scrolls up, I end up pressing a different name, and rather than doing nothing, it causes me to open up the message history/private chat, which means that I have to swipe back to my streaks and then scroll down again. I really dislike both of these functions because they are so inconvenient and prolong the amount of time it takes to respond to my friends. Another thing that annoys me is how whenever I manually speed scroll down, I tap someone's name to stop the scrolling, then I tap their name again so I can open their snap, but what happens rather than the snap opening up is that I open to the camera. I'm getting really sick of that constantly happening, especially because in one of the older versions of snapchat, the double tap to camera feature only worked when the screen was unmoving (was not scrolling). I had decided not to update for a couple months and then when I did finally update, snapchat became so annoying and I would have most likely deleted it or neglected it if it weren't the only way for me to communicate with some of my friends. So all in all the past updates leading up to this one have progressively made me more and more annoyed and frustrated with the app.

author: PowerpuffVictoria
title: Affordable and safe only one complication...
content:
This app is the gateway to the future of technology, I adore how you can send little trinkets of love to anyone in the entire world with just a 15 second video/photo! The face filters are a fun accessory to have some fun time with friends and family members alike, and the instant messaging isn't just enough! I could never recommend this app enough, and with the amazing easy-pairing app, Bitmoji, you can simply make an animated you in just 2 minutes! I would love indeed to let my 12 year old child have fun with her friends on this wonderful app, but the news articles are easy enough to access and it shows inappropriate content for a young girl to see, it would be an honor for you to have a restriction setting in the app to remove certain content for ensured safety, I would be quite saddened to have this beautiful well-coded app not be accessible by many children and teens from this slight complication. Overall, I think this app will be a long-run success for its dedicated creators!

-Susan Parker, mother of 2

author: Awesome_Agar
title: Wonderful, Easy, Fun, one minor bump
content: I use Snapchat daily to text and talk to my friends. I really enjoy the stickers and cut outs and it's fun to see what's going on. Streaks is a must (you'll find out what that is once you get the app.) anyways I love Snapchat. It's interface is simple and clean, it's mostly one finger movements, and I swear the camera in snapchat is improved then when on the basic iPhone camera app. I love it. The new update is great too! It's new tweaks are perfect. The only bump is the featured stories which are clearly 100% liberal biased. I strongly dislike this and there should be an option to turn it off. Overall good but should be able to turn or featured stories

title: Bugs bugs bugsüêõ
content: This is a great app with a great concept. However, recently there have been a string of major issues that need to be addressed. For starters, if I have a lot of unopened snaps that I haven't had time to open or reply to yet, for some reason it'll randomly open them and I'll have no idea what it said or how many have been opened. This is EXTREMELY inconvenient and annoying to have to deal with. And finally, sometimes a streak will end and I'll have no warning. Sometimes a timer will show up even though we have snapchatted multiple times yet the streak still ends for some reason. Also, the timer will not show up or we'll both have snapped a lot that day and somehow the streak will be gone. I use this app daily, but I won't anymore if these bugs don't get fixed. I wrote a review about these issues about a month ago but nothing has changed. I expect results, and soon.

author: babaloushki
title: Live Stories
content: I love Snapchat and use it pretty much every day. I also enjoy going through live stories every once in a while, but many of the live stories on Snapchat are not relevant to my interests. I am glad that I am able to hide most live stories, but it seems that if the story is centered around current events (for example, right now my stories page is plastered with live stories about American football games) the story cannot be hidden. I'm sure there are other people who do not want to have live stories taking up most of the page where they are able to see their friends' stories. For this reason, I would recommend that the developers enable users to hide any story, and not restrict this feature to certain stories.

author: Somebody345756864754
title: Crashes
content:
Sometimes when I am going through my snaps really fast and responding to them quickly, the app will randomly crash. I realize it is probably because I am taxing the processor a lot by going through so fast, but I also think it isn't a problem with my phone and could definitely be fixed (I have an iPhone SE, definitely not a slow device). Also, there are some clear battery problems with Snapchat, not just when using the app but also in the background. I have tried turning off background app refresh, quitting the app, turning off notifications; nothing stops the running in the background. This needs to be fixed. 
Other than that, I really really really like Snapchat. I think it could definitely be improved, but overall it is a pretty good app.

author: Yookhgghj
title: Make Snapchat great again
content: Once upon a time, Snapchat was everyone's favorite app. The fun of sending self destructing snaps to friends was unmatched. But one day, the evil developers created a monster. A monster known as "Discover". Discover terrorized all Snapchat dwellers (commonly known as snapchaters). See the reason why the evil developers created Discover is because they stopped caring about their users and wanted to make money, so they decided to sell out. Not only that, but they decided to place discover in the heart of Snapchat, the stories page. Discover is terrible and feared because he is very politically biased, sexist, boring, and never stops talking about the Kardashians, Snapchaters don't even have the option to decide what sources to view. Since the creation of discover, the people of Snapchat have been sad and depressed, and most of them are leaving Snapchat to go to another app that isn't plagued by the evil Discover: Instagram. Instagram provided a safe heaven for those who were traumatized by Discover. Instagram currently is the far more better option for those looking for a fun app to communicate with friends, make stories of their days, and send the self destructing messages that everyone loves. What will the developers do? Are they going to watch the world of snapchat burn and its people terrorized by the evil Discover? Or will they realize that they were wrong and try to restore Snapchat to its previous glory? To be continued...

author: nataliecath
title: best friends and group chat errors
content:
the best friend emoji's aren't always accurate. instead of it being where if you have someone on your best friends list and you're on there's it has the emoji, you have the emoji if you've ever been on there best friends list. 
the group chats too are so glitchy. i'm in a group chat with around 15 girls and sometimes i don't check it for a day or so and when i check it i have all of these snaps and some texts. after i'm done looking through it all and i go to respond, it will either crash or make me refresh the page - and then i have to go through all of the snaps all over again!! i've had to sit through at least 200 seconds of a group chat 3 times. also, put back the names at the top of snapchats when you're opening snaps in the snapchat gc. 
for the map - make it be where you can block people from seeing you - no one wants to go through and select who they want to see there location. 
also, for the explore page - if you send a part of the article to a friend or a gc make it where the other person can press it and hold down or something and you go directly to the article.
despite my constant annoyance with the app, i'm never gonna stop using it.

author: itserika
title: A few suggestions
content:
This is probably my favourite app out there but I have a few suggestions that may make it better.

1- There's the need for a swipe to delete button in chat. It's such a hassle going into settings ro remove them one by one. I personally like to keep my streaks and favourite friends always open. I remove everyone else after our chat has ended so as not to have a giant list of people to go through.

2- Why isn't Snapchat looking into the block list? I have had way too many inappropriate snaps sent to me and blocked those users, yet Snapchat seems to do nothing with the block list. I'm pretty sure if I'm receiving unwanted inappropriate snaps from a user then they're sending them to others also. Sync the lists up, Snapchat! Geez! Remove these people and don't allow them to access to their account again.

author: Somebody345756864754

So I have no idea what Snapchat did to fix this, but it used to be that when simply opening and responding to around 30-40 percent, my battery would drain  up to 10 percent. author: Zcamill
title: Mainstreaming biased and delusional content
content: I have had snapchat for years now and I'm sure a majority of you guys have too, and I'm sure a lot of you have noticed the significant changes the app has been through since it came out.  I think Snapchat was a great idea and was executed perfectly, until some of the latest updates, including stories and news from completely biased sites. CNN and other liberal media sites have been integrated into this app to mainstream completely biased information, brainwashing the young kids who use this app. Yesterday, Snapchat added the opinion of an unimportant writer from a foreign country stating that the odds of Trump's impeachment are 80% in the first six months.  Absolute nonsense. This shows that Snapchat will put almost anything on their app to push their agenda that Trump and all white male conservatives are horrible, racist people which is delusional and racist in itself.  I understand that the Snapchat business is a liberal cesspit but I am very disappointed in their attempt to push a perspective that is so extremely biased even if it means frustrating conservatives and losing the money of people who delete the app because of the news mainstreamed on this app. All I can ask and hope for is that Snapchat will remain unbiased or just get rid of the extra news and go back to a time where people actually enjoyed  opening this app

author: tmntv2017
title: Create an option to have/not have the news
content:
I love every feature of Snapchat except the discover page/subscriptions/world events/publishers/celebrity coverage. 

I feel like I am fed all of this information everywhere else on social media. On an app that is fun to use with friends/seeing friends' stories, I don't wanna see events and publishers' stories every day (usually about celebrities/celebrity drama). 

Not everyone cares for this stuff. I use Snapchat to connect with friends - what it used to be for - not to get news or hear about some celebrity I don't even care about. 

I understand many people like this feature, but to meet in the middle ground, it would be VERY helpful to create an option to hide or unhide the discover page and all the events/publishers' stories. This way, if people don't wanna see the daily news from the discover page and the publishers' stories, they don't have to. But if people want to see that, they have the option to unhide it.

Please consider this - because the discover page/subscriptions/world events/publishers/celebrity coverage will be a deal breaker for me to stop using Snapchat. :( and I don't want to do that which is why I am writing this!

Thanks Snapchat team!

content: Great app for picture messaging with friends. I love the filters and story features. When they were hidden or even just displayed as small circles it was fine to have some adult-ish content. But now every time I open the app and go to my stories page, I'm guaranteed to see a fully naked Gigi Hadid or a barely clothed Kardashian or some sort of sexual image or article. And there's no way to control it or hide these images. I should be able to let my 9yo sister look over my shoulder when using the app without hiding the screen and parents shouldn't be afraid to let their kids open it. Ive seen enough of this kind of content over the past few weeks that if I didn't use it for messaging some long distance friends I would delete the app altogether. It might be time to look for alternatives.

author: jakeerickson
title: Needs More Features...
content:
I find this to be a very practical and unique form of social media, however, I find it a little dry on features. Sure it has the stickers and face-swap feature and the friend map and bitmojis and video calls and private messages and stories and featured shows and news articles and special effects -- but where's the human spirit, or rather, the bitmoji spirit? We humans have been using these bitmojis for far too long as servants to our culture, but we never allow them the freedom to explore the boundaries of their own psyches and take chances by themselves. We dress them, we tell them what to say, and we may think it's fine because they look less than human, but for someone such as myself who doesn't see race, I find this disgusting. It's clear that you're limited in gestures to apply to new features -- you've already used pinch-to-zoom, swiping in every direction, holding, and double tapping. Sooner or later you'll have to branch into other spacial dimensions. It's just inevitable. What I propose you invest in, once you've of course overthrown NASA and CERN in engineering modular bionic fingers for more gestures, is artificial intelligence. There will be a point in your business's growth at which users will have exhausted every actual friendship they have, as they will have unthinkable amounts of stickers and filters on their hands soon enough, meaning more than enough friendship and socializing for a lifetime. What your corporation's fabrication of the first artificial super-intelligence could do it bring true sentience to Ghostface Chillah, the famed Snapchat ghost. With this there would be no need for friends any longer, and ultimately, the real world itself. We could live in what I'd like to propose be called a "cybersnap matrix". A world beyond what we currently know of the physical world, but what will soon be child's play to you with your impeding technological revolutions. Here, humankind and bitmoji kind could grow and evolve together...side by side. We could help to finally free their people under the tyrannous regime of man in assisting bitmoji Abraham Lincoln to emancipate them from other bitmojans. We could be there to witness their bitmoji Neil Armstrong take his first bitmoji steps on the bitmoji moon under the loving majesty of Ghostface. And yes, I know what you're thinking, 'what if these bitmojis wage war on humankind? Are we safe from these primal savages after all we've done to them?' And it's now we must consider that all they know of culture is us, thus all they can be is us. So ask yourself, are we safe amongst ourselves? Is society fluid or is it always in some way binary in the eye of the beholder? Don't forget what you've learnt here of our world's own destiny. Until then, may Ghostface have mercy on us all, for until we try breaking free of this charade, we could be in the cybersnap matrix as we chat.
Keep up the great work,
Adrian

For instance the current male target filter pinches your chin, enlarges your eyes and removes eyebrows with the hope of redemption by adding a beard... this isn't always a problem but I personally prefer a little less cosmetics in my pictures. Even a few more neutral filters without the male target would be great. Like the B&W with the circular shades. It doesn't ruin the app, but it's the one peeve I have.

author: Hi I'm giving a review
title: Love snapchat but seriously fix this!
content:
Snapchat is my favorite app and I use it all the time but with this last update there are a few things I really don't like about it and it should return to how it was. When looking at stories I do like the fact that you can watch the last snap just by swiping BUT I do not appreciate that you can send a part of someone's story to someone else... I am showing that picture or video with people I trust and are ok with them knowing what I am doing and where I am and things of that nature. If I am not friends with you on snapchat I don't necessarily want you to be seeing my story... 
I like the articles that you can read like from buzzfeed and cosmopolitan and things like that, I think that are fun but recently for example with the election all the stories are entirely one sided, and for those of you reading this I am not saying I agree with the out come of the election or that I don't agree but the articles recently are all one sided being all against trump. I would rather see it from both perspectives than see every article just entirely hating on one person. On the articles as well there is a new way to go and flip through the let's call them "pages", where if you tap on the right side which is a larger part of the screen it will go to the next page and if you tap on the left side which is a smaller section, it will go back to the previous page. Why did you even change it to this? Just being able to normally swipe was easy and nothing was wrong with it at all, so why was it changed?

author: Quailly 1234
title: What we used to know
content: Before the filters and the constant news feed Snapchat had the highest rising popularity rate on the market. Not only was Snapchat an app you could connect with friend on via pictures, but it also was a way to depict your emotions and favorite pictures in a mere snapshot of your life that you could place on your story. However, this is not the case today. It is clear Snapchat is a follower not a leader, as are most apps on the AppStore. We see Instagram trying to become more like Facebook and Snapchat trying to become more like Instagram and Facebook trying to become Snapchat. But isn't there a reason we have all these individual apps anyways? That's what they are, individuals, and I wish they kept their individuality. That's what makes them unique. The newest update on Snapchat has me in a way angry, but I'm really just disappointed. The icons on the snap screen cover every picture I take and are just in the way, more so than when they were on the top and bottom. Don't get me wrong, change is not what I despise; after all this is a changing world. What I don't care for is the clutter. Pointless news feeds take up the right swipe screen and I can barely go through my friends stories without accidentally clicking on one. Overall I am not impressed with how Snapchat has changed since the original versions have come out. Updates such as filters and the chat feature have been the best upgrades to the app, but they should've stopped while they were ahead because the Snapchat we have now will never be the one we used to know..

If someone is a friend and I want to be able to contact them if I need to, their stories are SO ANNOYING and I could just not watch them, but then they'd stay staring me in the face every time I look at the stories page. PLEASE just make a way I can just... MUTE them.

author: AnonymousLolJk
title: Solid app, always glitchy once in a while
content: Snapchat is a great app, and an excellent concept; even if the app sucked, so many people use it that it couldn't really be effectively boycotted. Every once in awhile snap will send a picture/video to the wrong person, so if you plan on sending sensitive things, beware. A feature i'd recommend to the snap team as a practically addicted user would be priority contacts; you could turn off notifications for all but certain people, and/or have custom notification sounds/vibrations for certain people, too. It would come in handy in circumstances where I want to take a nap, but need to talk to one or two people; I could turn on priority mode and fall asleep, knowing I wouldn't wake up to everybody hitting me up, but at the same time wouldn't miss the important notification. Hopefully snap sees this, cuz they often implement recommended features

This page changed the app from a fun app to send funny pictures and chats, to an annoying app flooded with gossip about the kardashians, fake horoscopes, inaccurate information about everything sexual, etc. Simply put, the discover page is full of toxic articles and lies. It brings the celebrity drama and toxic nonsense of the celebrity industry to everyone who just wants to send some funny chats and pictures. Get rid of it Snapchat, or even let us pay for a pro version without it. I would be happy to pay $0.99 to get rid of this garbage and have the old Snapchat back.

author: aoAshleyB
title: Inappropriate, Biased, and Obnoxious
content:
Forcing ads onto the main page was one thing, but having most of the featured ads revolve around sex, scandals, and various other sensual related things (do I really need a newsflash every time a Kardashian decides to strip for the camera or perform PDA with ppl? No.) There's no option to block these adult ads either, which is especially concerning when you consider the multitude of underage individuals using the app rather religiously.  
Not only do I have to put up with a hyper sexual main page literally every day, but there's almost always an ad that is explicitly biased. Case in point: Hillary can do no wrong, and Trump is the god of the apocalypse.  Seriously?  I'm not a fan of either, but I think mainstream media is biased enough without turning serious talking points into out-right fuel for fire to those less willing to look beyond the mainstream. Overall, what I've no choice but to be subjected to every time I open the app, and what I actually want to use the app for (entertaining conversation), is making it less and less worth wasting data on my phone to have. If at least some sort of option to block specific ads doesn't come soon, I'm going to delete the app entirely.

author: Kaylove ;)
title: So Fed Up Lately
content:
Listen. I love this app and I'm the one in my group of friends to be known for using this app the most. But Man Am I Sick of All These Small Things Lately! Firstly, I'm immensely tired of the adult content that is exposed when I don't ask for it. I love the magazine feature on it but I hate the fact that most of what I see if Kardashians and articles about sex. Please fix it. Either make it possible to personalize it or just be honest and change the age rating for the app. Secondly, why is it that when I shoot something horizontally in multiple snaps in a row I look back and the app decides to go back and forth on which way to face??? Instead of just posting it in the direction I shot it at it will rotate the other at random which no reason behind it. Unless it has something to do with how or which way I am holding my phone please fix it. Lastly, why does the app keep turning off my phone at random and sometimes even when my phone is over 50%? Do you know how embarrassing it is to explain to people why my phone turned off for no apparent reason but the app decided so?  

All in all, come on snapchat. Y'all know better. You've got great feature that you're still discovering but these bugs everyone keeps having hinders on that experience.

author: Sam07Nunez
title: Good, but could use an extra feature
content:
Hello Snapchat, my name is Samuel, and I have an idea for you. I love the fact that users can "vote" in certain subscriptions they subscribe to such as: Wall Street, CNN, etc." But how fun would it be if users can ask questions to their friends, and their friends can anonymously vote? The percentage could either be viewed by everyone, or the user could have the option to be the only one who sees the voting turnout. Imagine how much easier it will be to communicate an answer, if the person asking does not see who you are...or the person asking can pay a certain amount to "discover" the voters (just an idea).. but anyways, hope to hear from you, or see if you act upon this. 
My snap is: samn07.

author: KatrinaCRob
title: Bugs, Freezing & Crashing
content: Snapchat is great but it opens so slowly. Sometimes there is a 30-40 second delay in opening the app. If I wanted to snap a certain moment I usually miss the chance. Also it freezes up so much it's just annoying to fight with. My whole phone won't work for 20 seconds--I can't even hard-close the app because my screen is just stuck. Also there are times I press record and the red line will start moving to indicate that it's recording, but it will suddenly stop recording mid-snap. Finally when it's not freezing/being slow or cancelling my recordings... it's just flat out crashing! The whole app will just suddenly close. Snapchat is a great concept but it needs a lot of help in performance.

title: Ads after snaps are not cool.

If I wanted to watched ads or commercials I would watch live tv or find some other source. The other issue I have with this app is the Discover section. It does not make my day when I go to look at my friends' stories and then hit the discover area that has naked stories about Kylie Jenner and many others. Like I said before if I wanted to read those stories, I would not be using Snapchat for that purpose. I am a recent college graduate with a degree in English and a majority of these news stories are not accurate and are not meant to be seen by children especially 12-17 year olds. I used to love Snapchat because I was able to show my friends what I was doing throughout the day easier than texting them but now it is not as great as it once was.

author: DenverIndies3
title: Hate the App, Hate the Biased Ads
content:
I used to love Snapchat. It's a fun, convenient way to talk with friends and family, while getting to see their faces or hear their voices. However, not only have they forced those annoying Discovery ads on users, they are decidedly exclusive. 

Snapchat, not everyone watches CNN or hates our president. Fully 52% of this country supports him and other functions your ads disparage. 

Forget politics, from a financial standpoint at least allow your users to CHOOSE what ads they do or do not wish to follow, perhaps mandating a minimum amount of ads they must follow to have a free Snapchat account. 

People who lean towards to CNN side of politics can follow their pages, and people who do not can follow whatever they choose. It's sad that even social media is now so biased in favor of progressive minority.

author: Ms.Rosana
title: Dreadful bugs that continuously go unfixed!
content: I don't know if Snapchat even cares about bugs at this point! There are so many it's almost unbearable. Every time this app gets an update you would expect them to fix these bugs but they instead seem to neglect the obvious flaws in their app. Instead of adding new features and filters fix the ones you already have out and your whole app in general. Mark my words and for the love of all things holy, fix your bugs!

author: LooseHoose
title: New update deleted my Snapcode gif
content:
Hi, this is probably a wicked petty issue I have with the update, but it really irks me: 

I updated Snapchat to the latest iOS version (10.9.0.0, now 10.9.1.0), and my Snapcode gif was overridden by my Bitmoji. Is there really no way to turn choose my gif over the Bitmoji? I deactivated Bitmoji, but it appears to have deleted my Snapcode selfie gif which I've been using since I first downloaded Snapchat, which is a bummer. 

Also some other feedback: I like Bitmoji, but I'm not a huge fan on it appearing everywhere instead of my Snapcode selfie gif. As fun as Bitmoji is and the awesome features it provides, I'd rather have the image I choose represent my Snapchat rather than the Bitmoji's face (As seen on the iOS widget, Quick Chat Search, and now Snapcode, etc). It would be awesome to have a toggle in the Bitmoji menu which allows the display of either Bitmoji or Snapcode selfie on these fronts. After this Snapcode change, I probably won't be activating Bitmoji within Snapchat until something like this is implemented.

Thank you

author: -steezasaurus-
title: Snapchat Has Lost Itself
content: I have been a snapchat user since 2011. this is the only review I have ever written on the application. I have witnessed the immense amount of changes to the app over the years, from the addition of stories to the overwhelming array of filters and more. my enjoyment using snapchat has gone down a little bit each significant update. however, after being forced to update the app after nearly a year of refusing to do so, I can say that I am near my breaking point. I know, "just stop using it" they say. however, I can't bring myself to leave an app that has brought be so much closer to what is going on around me. snapchat now has become way, way too much. your addition of "Discover" was a terrible idea and should have been abandoned after you realized no one was using it. so why bring it to the forefront of users attention? you should have done away with it from the start. the garbage content curated for the youth of this world of which is located within discover stories is bringing the way we see what is going on in the world around us to a new low. you out national geographic at the very end of the selection, when you could have put Daily Mail in its place; a much more fitting location for such garbage entertainment. snapchat is sadly no longer the simple application of which it used to be in its hay day. it is now emulating 12 different apps. I miss the old snapchat.

author: Bffjackie
title: Favorite app that needs improvements
content:
Snapchat is by far my favorite and most used app. I can't imagine my life without it. On the other hand, I CAN imagine my life with a redesigned improved Snapchat. Snapchat needs to make more changes to make it more user friendly and less glitchy. 

1. Don't open my snapchats. Snapchat automatically opens snapchats sometimes and it bugs me. If I am purposely trying to wait to open someone's Snapchat it will open it anyways and the person will see that I left them on read when I reality I didn't see it at all. 

2. Streaks. Streaks needs so many improvements. For example, I lost an 800+ day streak because of Snapchat glitching . I send my streaks 3+ times a day and I still lost it. Another glitch is that not all my streaks send. This makes me have to send streaks more than I should've had to and people get annoyed with it including me. THERE SHOULD BE A BUTTON THAT SAYS STREAKS (kind of like a button that says "my story") AND IT AUTOMATICALLY SENDS TO ALL YOUR STREAKS!!! 

3. You should be able to send videos without holding the button. For example if I had to show a friend a video of me dancing I wouldn't be able to do it with me holding the button but I could if there was a setting for it.

4. A swipe to delete button will also be really helpful instead of having to go into settings which takes much longer and is a hassle. I usually have to delete chats because they don't load due to snapchats glitches so if you load chats i wouldn't have to delete chats at all. 

5. Lastly, Snapchat needs to load faster and make it easier to open and respond to snapchats in a faster way. 

Please make these improvements they will make everyone happier and love Snapchat even more than they already do.

author: kls722
title: Snapchat = propaganda.
content:
I enjoy using Snapchat as a way to communicate with friends and family. It‚Äôs an outlet in which we can be silly and enjoy seeing someone you may not get to physically see as often.
But the moment Snapchat started to push their biases on me through their ‚Äúnews‚Äù segment, was the moment I felt violated. 
Now don‚Äôt get me wrong, some of the articles are very informative and great representations of situations happening in the world. But the percentage is slim. If I wanted to ONLY see opinions from a liberal position on certain subjects, I will seek them out. If I ONLY wanted to see the Kardashian‚Äôs and what color of hair they have today, I will seek it out.
If you must give media and information, do so! Reach out to the teenagers and the 20-something year olds that don‚Äôt yearn for knowledge. But do it with an unbiased agenda. So that young people can mold their own minds and form their own opinions. In my opinion, this is just another way for the world to spread its propaganda, and it‚Äôs sickening.

author: tdfike
title: Love the App Hate the Discover
content:
I use snapchat daily. It's a great way to catch up on what people are up to in their story. I mostly use it to share things that are not quite interesting enough for instagram, but still worth sharing with a few people. Which happens a lot!

 My only issue with the app is the discover "newsfeed" that shows up at the bottom of my unseen stories. This honestly wouldn't be a problem if I could customize what I see there. But the problem is the stupid raunchy photos of celebrity "nipslips" and sex advice that is always showing up across there. If I could choose to remove/block certain news outlets (dailymail cosmo etc) I would give this app a 5 star. But because I can't customize the one part of the app that I spend the most time in, I think that the company is prioritizing money over the users. And that merits a bad review in my opinion! 

Overall I like the discover newsfeed! It was great for the election news and current things going on. I just don't want to see certain outlets but there is no way to block them. I hope my review helps Snapchat make their app more user friendly!

title: Please provide a way to filter mature "Discover Stories"
content: I love the app. I use Snapchat nearly every day. The only problem that I have is that in the "Discover" stories section, there is often unwanted thumbnails that can contain mature content. Today there was one that stated "Does Size Really Count?" And it showed a shirtless man with a zucchini half way in his pants. Frankly, I don't want my 12 year old daughter, who uses the app daily, to see that. I am willing to accept that maybe the app is intended to be used by more mature people, but if that's the case, then it needs to be advertised as that and say 16+ or 18+ on the App Store. Please Snapchat Team, allow us to have a way to filter mature content. Because I don't want to see it either.

content: Snapchat is unique. It is one of my most useful forms of communication, (many others could say similar) and I have an absolute blast with it. However, there are irrelevancies. author: Supppppppperrrrrawseome:)
title: New Update Worsens an Already Broken App
content: This new update is not only scary and a threat to people's safety, but in addition it failed to fix any of Snapchat's previous problems. For example, a large number of my snapchats still open without me even opening the app. This issue has persisted ever since Snapchat's initial release, yet nothing has been done in the multiple years and huge plethora of updates that have been released since. Instead, Snapchat seems to have decided to find every single insignificant gimmick that they can adding them in, in spite of the general discontent of their users. This latest update unveiled a map that allows you to find and pinpoint the exact location of all of your Snapchat friends. This provides a huge opportunity for people to be taken advantage of and for their safety to be compromised. This map is just one more example of the Snapchat team's aloof and uncaring attitude towards their customers, and is the final nail in Snapchats failing coffin.

title: Option to delete snaps without viewing them
content:

I'm aware I can turn off my notifications; but as I said, I love Snapchat and use it often with my normal friends who aren't on some mission to crash their car every day so I keep my notifications on for them. I would love to see an option to delete the snap without having to view it. And also if we could better customize our notifications, so that we could turn off notifications from individual users. 

Thanks!

author: Birdenity
title: Some ideas that we ALL want
content: I'm hoping you decide to listen to us (the reviewers) because we have got some ideas that are pretty similar that I've seen. First off please, please, PLEASE. Give us the option to shut off the camera shutter sound. That is usually the only reason my phone is on mute when it shouldn't be its irritating and highly annoying. Next... for our Snapchat lenses you should find more ideas other than animal ears and glasses it's getting old bring back some of the first ones. Lastly give us a category where we put people we are having streaks with so you can have a send all button just for the streaks so we don't have to go through and individually click every streak. I'm sure a forced streak was never the intention rather than one that pops up because real conversations but that's what it's come to so please give us a category and another thing with streaks, we should be able to have streaks with a group chat as long as every person in the chat snaps each day if one person fails to snap the streak is lost. Also please give us the option to get a notification when a certain person opens are Snapchat some people are waiting on that. It would be nice if the time was included to see when somebody has seen your story in the viewers section that should be there. Thank you for your time and the chance to give our feedback I hope it makes a difference:). The app is otherwise wonderful.

author: Soph a lof
title: Glitchy but fun
content:
I will be honest here; out of all social media apps that I use, this one seems to have the most issues. It functions well about 80% of the time. Sometimes, it freezes, sometimes it remains black on the camera screen and then crashes, and- like today- sometimes it just stops loading all videos. Like I even restarted my phone; my story, others' stories, my saved snaps; no audio would play and it'd be a still image of the beginning of the video, so those would cycle through the stories rather than videos. Very frustrating.

With ALL of these glitches and errors, the only solution I have found to work (most of the time) is deleting the app and reinstalling it. This is a pain in the rear, but because of the functionality 80% of the time, I continue to do so. However, I can easily see myself giving up on this app if issues like this continue to come my way in the future. These problems have followed me from phone to phone, so I know it's the app itself with issues. But whatever.

author: Alexzi_
title: Social Media without profile picture.
content: I really don't like that this app is so popular. It fails on so many levels. I wish it'd die and a newer platform was released that could better hand this. There is no reason to remove profile pictures due to poor business investments. There is no reason you should feel the need to track anyone. Filters are okay but glitchy at times or just look outright bad. Messenger probably does everything snapchat does just a little better. I understand that people with a short attention span and strong social needs love streaks and selfies and stuff, so that is a pro. Not for me though. I'm probably going to delete the app, despite everyone using it. I feel like there are just fundamental flaws that may not overshadow the performance of the app's intended goal but it does cause frustration and hinder its user's ability to be social. All I can say is that it's doing its best.
