author: RadCat10
title: It's Snapchat. It's legendary.
content:
This app works because everyone has it. In hindsight it might not be the most impressive messaging system, but it's holding up thousands of user accounts. Here's the basic idea: as long as you have internet access, you can take a picture with your phone and send it to your friends and family who also have Snapchat. If you'd like, there is a a way to accumulate all the photos you've taken throughout the day into one slideshow for all your friends to see; it's called a "story". There are buttons you can press which add visual quality to your pictures, these are called "filters". Filters can make you a dog. Filters will flourish the environment with bubbles and flowers. These are very prominent features in Snapchat, and are changed daily. If you really want to, you can send text messages through Snapchat as well. One thing worth noting is that there have been past interferences with the photo archives. Meaning, there are people who have gained access to what users are exchanging. It's good to keep that in mind and be diligent about the photos you send to others.  
I'd call this a 5 star app because it has a huge following. Most of my close friends have a Snapchat account that they'll log into daily. It's great for long-distance communication and photo sharing. There'a a chance your favorite celebrity has an account you can follow too. Snapchat is a staple in social media culture, and probably has several more years on its lifespan. Very much worth the download.

author: Disapointed2256 :(
title: Left-handed users are inconvenienced by this update
content: So the new update has feature where you can tap on the right side of the screen to see the next snap, and tap on the left side to scroll back to previous snaps. Although this is a nice idea, it does not consider the fact that approximately one in nine users is left-handed and will therefore always tap on the left side of the screen. As a left handed user, this makes it so that I must consciously hold my phone in a different way just to view stories. This is unnecessarily inconvenient because obviously I will always use my dominant hand out of habit. This may seem like an obnoxious complaint, and I apologize for that, but this issue is impeding on the casual nature of snapchat that I enjoy. Could you at least add a setting so that left-handed users can opt to disable the feature?

author: Foxcow
title: Just stop.
content: Seriously Snapchat, stick to a layout, and stop trying to add unnecessary garbage. For being an app that was meant to be used to share moments easily, it's turning into an over-cumbersome app that seems to try and fit everything into one screen. I understand you're trying to be a "better than Facebook", but the app has become a serious mess. You keep trying to add useless elements like a kid adding glitter to a project to make it "look good". Stop trying to one-up your previous designs, choose one that you can subtly modify, or stop designing updates. Not only is it disappointing to see a completely different layout every time I log in, but it's completely unneeded. You need to fire whoever came up with this new update, because it's absolutely horrible. Find some new designers, who aren't looking to add sh** to the app for brownie points.

üö®HEAR ME OUT/FULLY READ PLEASEüö®
Does snapchat have flaws? yes. Does that mean you should leave a one star rating? no. Your suggestions won't get anymore attention with a 1 star rating vs a 5 star one. author: HetaliaLover<3
title: Fun but...
content: This app is great, that's easy to understand but what's preventing me from giving it five stars is the fact that it kills my battery faster than I can say onomatopoeia (not really but you get the point). I've noticed this issue awhile back when I opened the app and suddenly my phone died. Now this might not sound like a big thing but my phone was at 40%. I had to charge my phone and as soon as my phone turned on üí• it was at 40%. So just to test it out, I recently opened the app trying out the filters üòä while keeping track of my battery percentage and in less than 5 minutes (I kid you not) my battery went from 66% down to 52%. I would say for every 10-15 seconds, 1% of my battery went down. Now I don't know if it's my phone (iPhone 6s+/with the most recent software update) or the app which is updated as well. I've read that if I delete the app and download it again the issue should stop, so that is what I'm doing right now. If it doesn't work I'm still gonna use the app but I'll have to carry a charger with me 24/7.

author: Jwjoyd
title: App takes so long to load the moment is lost.
content:
The idea is great except it takes forever for the app to load. By the time the camera is actually functioning (not even mentioning the delay on taking the picture/video) the moment I wanted to capture it long gone. It's ironic that a company who's entire concept is about capturing spur of the moment footage hasn't invested in making sure you have to tool to do just that. It's almost reminiscent of the days when dial up and AOL was a thing. If there was an app that had a similar concept but actually worked I would eagerly  choose the other and would be a more frequent user.

Programmers out there: there is an open market on the monopoly Snapchat has. 
(I would say it could be my phone but this is a problem I've heard from too many users)

author: rileighchristenson
title: One of my favorites
content:
Snapchat is one of my favorite social media platforms. But there are a few things.
1. Bring back visible best friends. I love the emoji thing but I truly miss being able to see others' best friends. I'm always wanting to know how high I am on people's best friends, and if I'm even on it. Because there's no emoji to say if someone is your best friend, but you aren't theirs.
2. Let us choose how many best friends we have. I liked having 3, maybe 5, but for some reason I have like 7 or 8. Basically everyone I snapchat with. It doesn't make any sense when everyone is your best friend.
Other than that there isn't anything I can think of that I don't like about this app. It's a unique concept that generally keeps getting better.

author: HonestlyYall
title: Gateway to porn addiction

author: JonathanLevine
title: Re-Haul
content: Snapchat is a great application for socializing with friends, family and people around the world, but it has gone downhill over the years. The main page to see friends' stories has been cluttered up with news stories, and has put ADs, before the user. Snapchat needs to be redesigned completely, with a new, cleaner and easier to use interface, more customization, a new profile tab, the ability to tag other users in your snapchats, redesigned search & ability to discover new users based on your friends, and the option to completely turn off discover, or at the least, make it a separate page not intruding your friends stories and your stories. Please Snapchat, fix yourself. You're losing users on a day to day basis, and you need to fix these problems before we all end up resorting to Instagram.

author: Rebe210
title: Just a couple things
content:
First of all, I love snapchat, it's one of my most used apps. However, there are a few things that are making me upset. 
1. The fact that my feed scrolls all the way back up every time I receive a snap or a snap gets sent. I HATE THIS. especially since I have many streaks, I want to be able to simply scroll down and reply to all the snaps instead of having it scroll back up every time I send one. Please fix this so I can be scrolling and replying to snaps and not have to find my place again every time a snap gets sent. 
2. I don't know if this happens to anyone else, but my snaps get opened by themselves if I don't open them in 5-6 hours. I understand the point of them is to expire, but it's not fair if they get opened overnight or while I'm in school without me seeing them.
3. Same as everyone else, go back to swiping/tapping for stories!!! Its so annoying to have to tap in a specific place. Please change that. 
Lastly 4. Please give us our privacy back with the stories. I don't want random people seeing my stories without my permission. If I did, I would have my stories on the letting everyone see them setting.

author: Breannalovespinterest
title: One of the few apps I use daily
content:
I don't use Facebook, Twitter, or Instagram. All in all, I'm not a big fan of social media. HOWEVER-I am young and inevitably find the best way to keep up with some friends is through social media.

 This is the only social media app I will use, for a few reasons. Before I deleted Facebook, I was constantly checking it and spending way too much time on it... Snapchat COULD be like that, but it doesn't have to be by default. As I've not got it connected with any other app, only the few people with whom I've shared the fact that I even have a Snapchat can consume my time. 

Even if I did decide to add a bunch of "friends" (aka ppl I don't even really like or know well, like I had done on Facebook) I have a choice of whose "stories" I view w/Snapchat. I can send pictures to just the few people with whom I'm very close, so I don't have to painstakingly screen what I post in fear of the wrong person seeing it. That's a big plus. 

The filters are also really fun. I'm not big on taking selfies, but the filters even entice me sometimes. Mostly I just use them on my cat, though. 

I end up reading a lot of the articles posted too, by groups like National Geographic. Everything is in such small portions, so I can easily digest it piece by piece in small short sittings, & it makes me a more informed person.

author: SlitherVeteran
title: Snapchat or 1984?
content: Remove. Snapmap. Immediately. I refuse to update the app until I have peace of mind in knowing that others can't see my location WITHOUT MY EXPLICIT INTENTIONS TO MAKE IT PUBLIC KNOWLEDGE. Before this update, location filters and text were acceptable ways to VOLUNTARILY share your location with friends. They didn't need to know your location at all times, let alone what side of your house you're sitting at!!! Now, this is not the case. Snapmap allows others to see your location at all times and this is unacceptable. The "ghost mode" isn't acceptable either because it shows the location at which you enabled this mode. I do not feel safe knowing that my location is on a map for all to see. This is an issue of privacy and internet freedom. I know I'm not the only one who feels this way. To Team Snapchat: remove this feature entirely and return Snapchat to what it was before or lose business.

author: Idrees Inc
title: New Snapchat update is potentially unsafe
content:
The new Snapchat update now shares your location with all of your friends, allowing pretty much anyone to see your exact address and current location at any time. It is opt-out, which means many people who update have already shared their location before they get the chance to disable this new "feature". Imagine how horrible this is for celebrities, cam girls, or other people who must share their snapchats with the world but don't want their location shown along with it for fear of stalkers. 
At this point, just disable location services on Snapchat. Sure, it blocks your ability to use filters, but it is the only way to be completely sure Snapchat isn't still tracking you. Plus, if enough people do it, Snapchat will be forced to listen, since it uses filters (and the data that comes with them) to earn some revenue!

author: Count.Your.Blessings
title: Amazing
content:
Such a fun app! I am not into social media (haven't a had Facebook account for over four years) BUT I'm loving this one!

Oh! And love how the filters make you look nothing less than F-L-A-W-L-E-S-S üëåüèºüíÉüèªüòÑ

UPDATE: I hate to do this put I have to knock down three stars üôÅ Personally, the headlines or news updates are way too much for me. I do not watch the news, don't watch TV at all because there's way too much negativity on there and now I feel like it's all in my face when I get on Snapchat. I would prefer to have an option to hide them.

Also, if you are going to keep the headlines then my suggestion would be to consider adding headlines from the GoodNews Network. I love reading their articles because the news they publish is all positive, always puts a smile on my face and gives me hope for this world. And I truly believe we need more of that!

UPDATE 10/11/16: Thanks for moving the headlines or news below the recent updates! 

Thanks!

UPDATE 12/6/16: Please give an option to remove or hide certain news outlets on the newsfeed section like the dailymail, cosmopolitan, etc. I do not appreciate seeing all these celebrity/gossip stories *gagging* being thrown at my face. A significant number of news stories on there are unnecessary for me to know. I just want to enjoy going on snapchat without feeling anxiety or disgust. Please do something about this. I appreciate that you have added the Dodo on the newsfeed. That and the National Geographic and Travel are the only positive news outlets out of the 27 on there üíÄ I feel my soul gets sucked out when I get on snapchat after I look at that newsfeed section. Add the GoodNews Network. Add other types of news that have nothing to do with politics, crimes, perversion, celebrities, drugs, materialism, etc. Add news or tips or stories that are good for our souls. Yoga, meditation, exercise, prayer, inspirational stories, inspirational speakers, like TED talks, Tony Robbins' talks, Deepak Chopra, Oprah, Marie Forleo, Louise Hay, Joel Osteen, etc. Add a "pay it forward" news section. A Vegan section. A book section. Something good. Show news that advertise what you want to see more of in the world. We want to see more love, peace, unity, healthy bodies, minds and souls. Right now you are showing a lot of what we do not want in the world. It's like you are advertising what we do not want to see. Greed, violence, materialism, idolatry, perversion, fear, hate, jealousy, unhealthy minds, bodies, and souls. Please just add an option for us to be able to completely remove the news outlets we prefer not to see or read. If you can, just remove it all. That's why we have newspapers and news apps and television to know what's going on in the news. Right now, you all (snapchat) have a great deal of influential power in the world. My little cousins, a 6 year old girl, 10 year old girl, two 12 year old boys, 14 year old boy, and a 17 year old girl, all have snapchat. Please use your great influence to influence us, the world, the best way possible. Please evaluate who you are partnering with and what you allow us to see. Feed our souls not our flesh, if you know what I mean. 

Thank you

I only say this to you cause I believe in Snapchat. The filters are fun and family friendly. I love people and I'm worried about our world and only want the best for it. Hope you can help make it a better one by putting out more good news not just garbage.

I understand these news outlets or sponsors may be sources of money. But I would definitely pay to have this app if you would remove them all from the app. And I'm sure so many others would as well.

Imagine... One version of snapchat without the newsfeed for a certain price. And another version of snapchat with the newsfeed for free. Those who want no newsfeed get to pay in order to support the app. And those who don't care whether they have newsfeed or not get to keep the free version. 

I think that would work üòå

content:
When I swipe to my stories page, I expect (and want) to see stories from my friends, as well as wholesome content from my subscriptions. However, Snapchat thinks that it is okay to post extremely inappropriate content at the top of my stories page every day. Honestly, I've had snapchat for just a few weeks and I'm already to delete it. 

Although I don't want to view those articles, it's just awful that anyone can see it, even children and teenagers. Although the app is for 17+, it should not post porn for the world to see, and they should at least have an option to turn it off. 

Snapchat needs to have more family-friendly content if they want to stay in business.

Honestly, is this how the world has become? Where all moral standards and values are tossed out?? Show some human decency, snapchat!

author: WordCookeProMan2
title: Has TERRIBLE parts to it...
content:
Don't get me wrong, I really like Snapchat. I use it all the time! However, there are some REALLY terrible parts to Snapchat that made me give it only 2 stars.

First of all, Snapchat ALWAYS crashes. If you open too many Snapchats at once and answer too quickly, the app just crashes. This is unbelievably annoying because when I reopen Snapchat, it says that I didn't open the snapchats I JUST tried to reply to before it crashed. For example, if I open 20 Snapchats and reply to 5 before it crashes and reopen the app, it will still say I have 20 unopened Snapchats. This needs to be fixed.

Second, Snapchat seems to have a difficult time with the emojis that show who you have a streak with, who is your best friend, etc. My friend and I on Snapchat were best friends with each other for 4 weeks, but he went on vacation and we were not best friends anymore on Snapchat. However, we STILL have the yellow heart emoji that says I am his best friend and he has been mine for 2 weeks in a row, but he is currently my #5. A new person also came on my best friends list, but the emoji that represents that still does not show up. This also needs to be fixed.

Third, when Snapchat crashes, it says that I have new stories to view, but they're stories that I viewed 8 hours ago. 

Snap Maps is also a huge problem. Not to mention it's creepy as hell, but it also freezes Snapchat ALL THE TIME. Whenever you try to open snap maps, the app will freeze on you, and you end up having to completely quit out of the app and tap on it numerous times before you can get back in. Get rid of Snap Maps. Zero purpose for it honestly.

author: therealvermon1112
title: Why...?
content: Ok the limitless feature is fine for photos, but to play videos over and over again is just pointless. If I want to see a persons snap again I can just rewatch their story or go back and watch the previous snap again. It doesn't make sense to play videos on a loop. Also, how are we supposed to know when something is on limitless when you took away the feature that told you how much time was left in the story. How am I supposed to know if someone's story is 5 snaps long or 50 snaps long... I seriously don't have time or patience to finish a story that may be 100 snaps long. Please fix this! Bring back the circle that told you how much time was left in a story and remove the limitless feature off videos, it's pointless and makes stories annoying.

author: Unibubbly
title: Very overrated (updated)
content:
I have so many problems with this app, bear with me and at least read this entire review before you judge it.
Pros:
-Easy to add friends
Cons:
-Messages disappear when you close the app
-Images disappear when you look at them twice 
-You get too many notifications (when people start typing, when people look at your picture,)
-No group chats
-No privacy (people know when you've read a message, when your on the conversation, when you have seen their picture, etc.)
-When you are notified that someone sent a message, it doesn't tell you what the message is until you open the app.

I know lots of my cons are why people like the app, but let me explain. So your friend sends you a message, you open it up and look at it and you might not respond right away. Maybe you're busy and you can't type, or your hands are full, or you don't have a response at the moment which is very likely. You close the app and finish what you're doing, and open it back up. The message isn't there anymore, and now you don't even remember what the question even was. Another example of when this is a horrible idea is if you need to look at something your friend sent you earlier to confirm details or something, and now you're out of luck because it's gone. I have the same problem with the picture/video, except at least you can see it twice before it disappears. The part where you can't see a message until you open the app bothers me to because there are situations where you want to see the message before the other person knows that you are there and read it (don't pretend it's never been like that with you). Anyways, I feel like these are problems that would bother people, because they certainly bother me. The reason my review is 2 stars and not 1 is because the app is fully functional, and I haven't encountered any bugs with it yet.

EDIT: I've only had this for a week and I've already been hacked and seen someone else get hacked. I don't know what my friend did, but I didn't click anything that could have easily made me vulnerable. Anyways, i'm lowering my rating to 1 star for the awful security.

author: sHiTeItSaLlAmA
title: Where my friends' stories at??
content:
Snapchat is one of my to-go apps to communicate with my friends, however there are a few issues/bugs that I would especially like to address with these past couple updates. 
Btw, I generally never write reviews but this is a little out of hand, so please listen and fix these!!
1) The snaps that your friends post to their stories should and have always been accessible for 24 hours unless they have deleted them manually. However, on my stories list, ALMOST ALL of my friends' stories are being deleted in 1 hour (sometimes 2 or 3) and are not accessible to me by any means. There are usually about 25 friends who do post to their stories on a regular basis and there is no way all of them decided to delete their stories at the same time. PLEASE FIX THIS AND I'LL GIVE BACK 2 STARS!!
2) Many people have addressed this already but about this Snap Map feature: I have my Bitmoji on Ghost mode anyway but the location tracker of my friends are surprisingly very accurate, which does raise my levels of safety for everyone. Because of this, many parents are scared of letting their teens have Snapchat, and I understand their concerns. Please either delete this feature altogether or make the app be able to disable the access this feature entirely for individual accounts. Thank you!
3) A little extra but quality? When you add text/emojis/filters to snaps the quality of the entire snap diminishes by like 75%, and it's been worsened in these last couple updates. Would be helpful if that's fixed thanks so much! (I have an iPhone 6 with iOS 10.3 if that helps)
4) Idk if this issue is with everyone but often whenever I use Snapchat while on data (and often on wifi) my phone (iPhone 6) either randomly restarts or just dies at any battery percentage below 35% while in the app (more often the latter and plugging into a power source does fix the issue but it is still very annoying). Please please please fix/improve the battery management of this app if that is at all possible, I will be very blessed.
5) Finally, some very minor suggestions. A 'send to all streaks" option would be extremely helpful to many of us. Also, CAN YOU MAKE A NOTIFICATION THAT ALERTS USERS WITH STREAKS IF THEIR STREAKS ARE ON THE LINE? (‚ùóÔ∏è‚è≥‚åõÔ∏è‚ùóÔ∏è) Many "heart attacks" would be saved...
Last thing, please try to improve the speed at which switching filters happens. It is currently a bit laggier than it has been earlier...
Thank you if you actually read and listened to our concerns!! üôèüèºüôèüèº Would give back a five star rating if all this is fixed!

author: Michelle Toni
title: Long time user... very disappointed.
content: I have been using the app long before the facial and location filters were introduced. Recently, the app has been shutting my phone off. When trying to turn my phone back on, the screen showed that my phone needed to be charged (even when I remember my phone being at 26% or something higher). I have been wanting to delete my account for a while and the sexual topics on the news outlets combined with this glitch finally pushed me to follow through. I thought it was my phone but that is impossible because my phone is still brand new. I will not be returning back to this app due to the inappropriate and raunchy news articles and the glitches that are just annoying. Thank you for the years of funny snaps with friends. I look forward to the extra time I will have from not being on snapchat.

author: Mark Sorace
title: Perfect
content: Snapchat has always been a must-have app for me, and since my initial download, the app has only gotten better. Snapchat is a great place to send any type of message, from photos to videos to messages and more. I love using Bitmoji, Stickers, GeoFilters, GeoTags, and Lenses. They all make the experience of sharing so much better. It's pretty cool that you can make your own GeoFilters and Tags as well. The introductions of sending camera roll photos, voice calling, voice messages, video calling, and group chats was amazing. Also, Snapchat's glasses called Spectacles are so fun to record with and watching the videos are unreal. All in all, I love the new look of Snapchat, it resembles iOS 10 very well.
